noun.description: A way in which something is usually done, especially within a particular area or activity.
examples: the woman who overturned so many conventions of children's literature

noun.description: An agreement between countries covering particular matters, especially one less formal than a treaty.
A large meeting or conference, especially of members of a political party or a particular profession.
An artificial bid by which a bidder tries to convey specific information about the hand to their partner.

origin: Late Middle English (in convention (sense 3)): via Old French from Latin conventio(n-) meeting, covenant, from the verb convenire (see convene). convention (sense 1) dates from the late 18th century.
